questions.question: Choose the correct indirect speech from questions: 1.1. "Why have you beaten my dog?" He said to me.

options.label: ক
options.text: He demanded me why had I beaten his dog

options.label: খ
options.text: He asked me why I have had beaten his dog

options.label: গ
options.text: He enquired me why had I had beaten his dog

options.label: ঘ
options.text: He demanded of me why I had beaten his dog

questions.option_a: He demanded me why had I beaten his dog
questions.option_b: He asked me why I have had beaten his dog
questions.option_c: He enquired me why had I had beaten his dog
questions.option_d: He demanded of me why I had beaten his dog

questions.question: The manager was pleased —— the team's performance.
Choose the correct synonym from questions: Prudent : ?
The train arrives ——- the station at 6:30 pm.
I finally killed the fly —— a rolled up newspaper.
Choose the correct antonym from questions: Authentic : ?
The conference highlighted —— urgent need for global data ethics.
May I borrow —— pencil, please?
He parked his vehicle under the shade of a tree.
Choose the correct synonym from questions: Reluctant : ?

Read the following passage and answer the questions: Unemployment is an important index of economic slack and lost output, but it is more than that. It is a phenomenon which can be termed as a social evil. For an unemployed person, it is often a damaging affront to human dignity and sometimes a catastrophic blow to family life. From the social point of view, an unemployed person suffers from a sense of discontentment, and unemployment problem may eventually lead to social disorder and anarchy. The cost of unemployment is not distributed in proportion to the ability to bear it. It falls most heavily on the young, the semi-skilled and unskilled, the down-trodden, the old worker, and the unemployed persons in a low-income rural area who are denied the option of securing more rewarding urban employment. There is more subtle cost of unemployment also. The social and economic strains of prolonged under-utilization create strong pressures for cost increasing solutions. On the labor side, prolonged high unemployment leads to ‘share the work' pressure for shorter hours, intensifies resistance to technological change and to rationalization of the work rules and, in general, increases incentives for restrictive and inefficient measures to protect existing jobs. 16.1. According to the passage, unemployment is an index of
Choose the correct sentence from questions:

options.label: ক
options.text: If I had known about the meeting, I would have attended it.

options.label: খ
options.text: If I would have known about the meeting, I would have attended it.

options.label: গ
options.text: If I was known about the meeting, I would have attended it.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: If I were known about the meeting, I had have attended it.

questions.option_a: If I had known about the meeting, I would have attended it.
questions.option_b: If I would have known about the meeting, I would have attended it.
questions.option_c: If I was known about the meeting, I would have attended it.
questions.option_d: If I were known about the meeting, I had have attended it.
